intro: Ornithogalum macowanii, commonly known as the Macowan's star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features a basal rosette of narrow, sword-shaped leaves and produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers during the spring and early summer. The plant is characterized by its showy inflorescence and is often found in grassy areas and rocky soils. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. Due to its striking appearance, it is cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic value.
